Speeches of a Most Worthy Sage was a book penned by Tharghin "Threeboots" Ammatar in the .
Tharghin Ammatars tome collected the sages musings and speeches on various topics. One part of note was dedicated to the philosophy of endings, death. The man argued for there being no real endings, only beginnings in life. He considered that pain of view quite elegant.
The original copy of Speeches of a Most Worthy Sage was kept in the library-citadel of Candlekeep on the Sword Coast as of the late 14 century DR.
